Package org.frc5010.common.config

Interface DeviceConfiguration

All Known Implementing Classes:
GyroSettingsConfigurationJson, PercentMotorConfigurationJson, VelocityMotorConfigurationJson, YamsArmConfigurationJson, YamsElevatorConfigurationJson, YamsPivotConfigurationJson, YamsShooterConfigurationJson
public interface DeviceConfiguration
Interface for configuring robot devices from JSON configuration data.

Implementations of this interface define how to instantiate and configure specific robot hardware devices (motors, sensors, subsystems, etc.) from JSON configuration objects. This pattern allows robot configuration to be externalized to JSON files while maintaining type safety and compile-time checking.

Typical usage: 

   DeviceConfiguration config = objectMapper.readValue(jsonFile, ConcreteConfigClass.class);
   MyDevice device = (MyDevice) config.configure(subsystem);
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • configure

      default Object configure(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.SubsystemBase deviceHandler)
      Configures and returns a device instance based on this configuration object.

      This method is called with the subsystem that will contain the device. The implementing class is responsible for creating the appropriate device instance using the configuration data and adding it to the subsystem if necessary.

      Parameters:
      deviceHandler - the SubsystemBase to configure with this device configuration
      Returns:
      the configured device object, or null if no device was created

    • configure

      default Object configure(GenericSubsystem deviceHandler)
      Configures and returns a device instance using a GenericSubsystem.

      This method delegates to configure(SubsystemBase) after casting the GenericSubsystem to a SubsystemBase. Subclasses can override this method for more specific handling when working with GenericSubsystem instances.

      Parameters:
      deviceHandler - the GenericSubsystem to configure with this device configuration
      Returns:
      the configured device object, or null if no device was created
